pros: Co workers are great to work with

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Lake Norman of Catawba, NC
pros: Very few feel satisfied with their job. Many feel they are under paid and under staffed. Food at cafeteria is too expensive with employees discount. Not as sanitary as it should be.
cons: Communication is not great between co-workers. New arrivals are dropped off without bedside report often leaving their healthcare workers unsure of their status, and treatment plans.

pros: People are nice and hospital is nice
cons: No set hours was there 2 years never got a raise even though I did a good job and had good reviews. Was told was going to have set hours but never happened.

pros: A lot of long term staff that has been there for a long time

pros: It is a great place to be

job_title: Certified Surgical Technologist in Mooresville, OH
pros: Small Community hospital where most everyone works together as a team.

pros: Decent benefits. Not much else.

pros: Good people to work with is the only benefit
cons: Poor management poor patio staff ratios

review_title: Nursing is very busy and stressed
pros: Friendly staff. Management is visible.  HR is on-site and accessible.  Time off is accommodated fairly well.  Compensation is within the norm for the area, though is on the low end of the scale. Management is available for consultation and appears to listen and some ideas are well received.
cons: Nurse to patient ratio poor.  Stress among nursing staff is very high.  There are many mandatory meetings, training and other tasks that are not able to be accommodated during the working day and require attendance on days originally scheduled as off.   Work/Life balance is not good.

review_title: LNRMC is owned by HMA so it is a profit ruled hospital, not a non-profit."
pros: There are really no pros to working to LNRMC except the location.  It is a quick commute for many who are not able to drive into Charlotte or Huntersville.
cons: There are many cons to working at LNRMC.  Staffing ratios are unsafe, especially in the ER.  Nurses are floated to other floors to care for patients outside their knowledge base.  This violates the nurse practice standard in NC.  Turnover of doctors in the hospital.

pros: Some of the best reasons to work at Lake Norman Regional Medical Center is the amazing nursing staff that go above and beyond to make patients and families feel well cared for and important.
cons: Some of the downsides to working at Lake Norman Regional Medical Center is that the company is for profit and everything they do is based on money and not on the people that work for them and the patients they care for.

pros: Fast paced, mostly good co-workers, good benefits.
cons: Low pay for the amount of work your are expected to do. They guilt you out of calling out when your are sick because the department is so understaffed to begin with that it is difficult to cover ordinary work shortages.

pros: Friendly coworkers. HR seems to be competent.
cons:
Very bad leadership in many areas including Information Technology and Accounting.

Very limited resources and for most tasks that were assigned to me I ended reaching out to other hospitals for guidance.

Pay is very low compared to other health care facilities.

Upper management and directors seem to only dictate and delegate tasks and are  not very helpful providing direction...it is a sink or swim organization

job_title: Diagnostic Medical Sonographer in Mooresville, NC
pros: Small community hospital trying to keep its head above water
cons: Poor management that believes in the micromanaging philosophy.  Pay scale is below average for the area. For the past year good employees have been fleeing this hospital like it is on fire.

cons: Company was bought out and will be closing the office I worked in moving to other states
